Title: Product Manager, Growth
RoleDescription:
An Important Note about Wayfair's In-Office Policy and Salary: 
Please note that this is a hybrid role based in Boston, and will require you to work in the office on Tuesdays, Wednesdays, and Thursdays.

The salary range for this position is $126,500 - $137,500 per year. The base salary offered may vary depending on location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Restricted stock units will be provided as part of the compensation package.

Who We Are:
Wayfair believes everyone deserves a home they love, and that furnishing your home should be a source of fun, not anxiety. Our product team plays a crucial role in making this vision a reality for millions of people around the world. Partnering with engineering, UX design, analytics, and business partners across Wayfair, our product team ensures that were building technology that solves important customer problems in elegant, scalable, measurable ways. We have a modern tech stack including sophisticated capabilities around AI, data science, multivariate testing, and personalization. Were a highly collaborative, supportive team that values learning, psychological safety, and intentional career development.
We are seeking an innovative, entrepreneurial and technical product leader to join the Growth Customer Experience product team. This role is pivotal in shaping how we differentiate Wayfair with inspiration-first discovery experiences, engaging customers visiting from various marketing journeys and creating helpful home project-oriented experiences. You will have the opportunity to leverage cutting-edge AI and personalization technologies to craft a best-in-class user experience, guiding customers on a seamless journey from the moment they land on our site. This role requires a candidate with a comprehensive understanding of complex, cross-functional systems across multiple domains and a passion for creating data-driven, personalized experiences. You will not only oversee the implementation of the product roadmap, but define the long-term strategy for how we introduce customers to our site, ensuring a unique and tailored experience for every individual.
 What Youll Do:

Use data to understand customer needs and behaviors; map those against business objectives, and transform that knowledge into AI-powered product enhancements
Build client agnostic backends that solve for the needs of customers across all of our platforms: iOS and Android apps, mobile web and desktop applications
Given a broad and complex product strategy, independently own and craft a sequenced set of outcomes and solutions over a 12+ month time horizon
Build and maintain roadmaps for your product(s); partner with user experience design and usability, analytics, engineering, technical program managers, other product managers, and stakeholders to translate your vision and roadmap into reality  
Drive measurable results and/or learnings using testing best practices; monitor performance of your focus area 

We Are A Match Because You Have: 

Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or equivalent combination of education and experience
3+ years experience working in product management. Experience in ecommerce, and at companies that own a significant tech stack highly valued.
An ownership mentality. Youve autonomously set a ~12 month vision for your domain, prioritizing a body of work that optimizes for customer outcomes. Youve challenged yourself and others to proactively improve your product, its reliability, and plans for its future state. You propose adjustments to priorities as needed, and take responsibility for outcomes, celebrating team wins and surfacing learning moments openly. 
Good judgment. You manage risk, know when to pivot, can assess multiple paths forward, and use data to inform and advocate for the right next steps
Proven results. You have experience moving the needle on KPIs. Youve unlocked customer value through strong product discovery and technical delivery. Youve partnered to get it done, and you have a proven track record of sustaining and maintaining a high bar for your product space, even post launch.
Experience building creative yet scalable solutions. You know how to balance short term learnings with long term solutioning. Everything you build is a series of tradeoffs, and your experience to date has helped you fine tune balancing those tradeoffs given a set of constraints.
Team leadership. You autonomously manage teams, have influenced cross-functional stakeholders, and know how to navigate multi-domain technical complexity. You drive a culture of learning, radical candor, process creation/adoption within you team(s) and your broader Pod / SuperPod

Title: Large Projects Sales Manager
RoleDescription:
The salary range for this position is $67,230-$81,800/yr +target bonus of $20,000/yr. The base salary offered may vary depending on location, job -related knowledge, skills and experience.
The Category Ops Project Specialist is responsible for driving operational excellence across the full project lifecycle within their given category - from category opportunity vetting to end to end opportunity management. This involves managed sales and B2B category stakeholder management coordination, customer and post-order communication, as well as order execution. This role acts as the central Account Management and Enterprise large project category owner - ensuring seamless handoffs, project deliverable alignment, resolving roadblocks, and facilitating clear communication to achieve successful project outcomes. In addition to project management, the category specialists will execute against sales capabilities and order placement, as the subject matter experts of the category. 
Key Responsibilities:

Opportunity Vetting

Gather key deliverable, product, and logistics details - including project scope, timelines, and delivery requirements.
Determine feasibility and next steps for customer engagement. 
Request additional insight and specs on the category project directly with the customer, providing visibility to the managed sales partner engagement.

End to End Opportunity Management & Project Prioritization

Partner with managed field sales teams to communicate with customers on project needs and budget, ensuring inclusion in the opportunity submission. 
Evaluate and prioritize projects based on potential value, partner lead times on deliverables, and customer deadline for completion.
Maintain visibility into the project pipeline to support proactive planning.
Align internal stakeholders and resources for execution, driving a timeline for completion forward.

Stakeholder & Customer Communication Strategy

Coordinate across relevant PSG team members to ensure smooth workflows and completion of the project in a timely manner. 
Act as the communication bridge between managed sales teams and Large Project team members to be the single source of truth for project needs.
Track and document opportunity timeline and needs to reduce friction and improve efficiency.
Drive key supplier negotiations and issue resolution by effectively partnering with sales ops on execution.
Coordinate with B2B category management stakeholders to ensure close alignment on category pricing strategy, product selection, and inventory positioning. 

Project Roadblock Escalation & Resolution

Identify and address risks or delays across the project lifecycle.
Escalate issues to relevant stakeholders and proactively provide recommended solutions to managed sales teams. 
Drive accountability and follow-up on open items until resolution, prior to order placement to project installation.

Order Execution & Procurement

Source and procure products for a category project, ensuring availability, quality, and alignment with project needs.
Place and track category-specific orders accurately and on time to support the project timeline.
Own category relevant project quoting, including bulk requests and tag items per room location. 
Manage SKU reselects and substitute out-of-stock items efficiently to avoid project delays and maintain the initial order integrity.

Post-Order Project Completion

Maintain visibility into final delivery, installation, and possible project delays - coordinating with the customer on their timing and managing the customers specific needs.  
Coordinate post-order support between the Service and the Large Project delivery/installation team, effectively facilitating next steps to complete the project.

Title: Greeter/AP Associate - Retail, Full Time - Perigold Luxury
RoleDescription:
Guest Host (Full Time)
Location: West Palm Beach
 
Brief Overview of Position
Perigold, the destination for luxury home, is opening its first physical retail stores, first-of-their-kind luxury retail destinations of 20-30K square feet, with the best products in all styles and from across our catalog including furniture, decor, housewares, and home improvement categories.  Come be a part of it!  We are looking for a Guest Host who will be responsible for welcoming and introducing guests to our store while simultaneously helping to be the frontline eyes and ears that identify any risks to store safety and security.  The Guest Host will report into the Assistant Store Manager, Guest Experience and will also be a part of a global Asset Protection team.  If you are a collaborative and engaging people-person who is diligent and thrives in a fast-paced environment, this might be the perfect fit for you.  
 
What youll do 
Guest Greeting 

Be the first impression of the store - greet and engage guests at the front door during business hours in a way that feels inviting and authentic and exemplifies our commitment to customer satisfaction and passion for luxury design.
Orient guests to store and provide shopping guidance and directions as needed. 
Refer customers as appropriate to Designers, Product Specialists and Guest Services for additional assistance.  
Maintain post, while providing clear and friendly information to customers.

Theft Identification / Prevention

Patrol the store and stand at assigned locations to create a professional and demonstrative visible deterrent to theft to all customers and associates.
Report suspicious external and internal activity to appropriate team member.
Conduct employee package checks for team members leaving the store.

Safety Monitoring + Reporting 

Identify and communicate any safety related concerns on the sales floor or back of house, by conducting safety related inspections.
Share feedback with leadership on safety observations.
Proactively react to safety incidents involving guests or associates.
Proactively address safety concerns in accordance with brand standards.
Complete thorough safety reports as required.
Attend safety related meetings to share safe ways of working and best practices.

 
What youll need

1+ year of customer experience in a retail or other customer facing setting.
Flexibility availability (including mornings, nights, weekends, some holidays).
Excellent customer service skills - including written and verbal communication
Knowledge of Google Systems including email, google sheets, and other google platforms.
Energetic and optimistic attitude. Ready to take on new challenges.

Physical Requirements 

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently required to stand, walk, talk and hear. The employee frequently is required to handle, or feel and reach with hands and arms. The employee is occasionally required to sit; regularly climb or balance; and frequently stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl. The employee must regularly, frequently or occasionally lift and/or move up to 50 lbs.
Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus.

 
Compensation & Benefits

Compensation starting at $20.00 per hour, which increases based on your relevant experience + substantial quarterly bonuses
Medical benefits, financial benefits, and a generous employee discount

Perigold is the destination for luxury home. Established in 2017, Perigold offers an unmatched selection of the worlds best design brands, with unique pieces for every style and space. The brand offers the highest quality pieces for home, backed by a quality guarantee and expert concierge support. They also offer free white-glove delivery and 30-day returns on most items. Headquartered in Boston, Massachusetts, Perigold is part of the Wayfair Inc. (NYSE:W) brand portfolio.

Flexibility to work evenings, weekends, or holidays as necessary.

Wayfair runs the largest custom e-commerce large parcel network in the United States, approximately 1.6 million square meters of logistics space. The nature of the network is inherently a highly variable ecosystem that requires flexible, reliable, and resilient systems to operate efficiently.

The Associate Director, Product Management will serve as the key internal product expert of Payments technology bringing deep prior experience from Payments and FinTech industries. Overview:At Wayfair, we believe a home should be as functional as it is beautiful and that starts with great design. As a Sr. Retail Designer of Cabinetry and Home Renovation, you'll turn customer visions into reality, guiding them through their renovation journey with confidence, creativity, and care. From kitchens and bathrooms to laundry rooms and custom built-ins, you'll craft smart, stylish spaces that reflect each customers goals, budget, and style.
Youll tap into your expertise in cabinetry, bath, and kitchen design. Youll lean into Wayfairs expansive product catalog from cabinetry and tile to flooring and plumbing to provide complete solutions for DIY homeowners and professional contractors alike. What Does A Cabinetry and Home Renovation Designer Do?

 Own the Design Process: Lead cabinetry and home renovation projects from concept to completion. Use 2020 Design Live or similar software to develop layout plans, renderings, and product recommendations based on customer inputs, measurements, and needs.
 Be the Technical Expert: Educate customers on cabinetry construction types (framed vs. frameless), materials (MDF, plywood, solid wood), finishes (painted, stained, laminated), and specialty features (soft-close hinges, pull-outs, and more).
 Deliver Personalized Consultations: Whether it's in-store, virtual, or in-home, you'll meet customers where they are. You'll listen deeply, learn their style and renovation goals, and recommend functional, beautiful solutions tailored to their timeline and budget.
 Connect the Dots from Start to Finish: Develop floor plans, mood boards, 3D visuals, and complete product packages. You'll manage each projects full lifecycle, from early design to final purchase, and offer support through post-order services to ensure a smooth renovation experience.
 Educate + Inspire: Stay ahead of design trends and new materials, bringing fresh ideas to every customer interaction. Help customers see how tile, flooring, kitchen, bath, and plumbing products can work together to create the space theyve dreamed of.
 Leverage Design + Sales Tools: Use analytics and digital tools to build persuasive space plans, presentations, and shopping experiences that help grow the business while putting your creativity to work.

 Design Experience: 3+ years of experience in kitchen, bath, cabinetry, or home renovation design. You know your way around spatial planning, product selection, and what works (and what wows). Bonus points for 12 years focused on cabinetry.
 Technical Proficiency: Youre confident working in 2020 Design software. Familiarity with CRM/POS systems (like Salesforce) helps too.
 Sales Know-How: Youve got a track record of meeting or beating your sales goals and you know how to build trust while selling big ideas and beautiful designs.
 Flexible Schedule: Retail hours mean nights, weekends, and holidays. Youre ready to show up when your customers need you most.
 Educational Background: A Bachelors degree or college diploma in a related field is preferred, but your experience and design sensibility speak volumes.
 Leadership + Training Experience: If youve mentored or trained others in a retail or design setting, even better! You know how to lift up your team and lead by example.

Title: Production Controller
RoleDescription:
The salary range for this position is $102,942.00-$113,778.00 per year. The base salary offered may vary depending on location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. 
Production Controller 
 
The Workflow Controller plays a vital role in staffing, planning, and achieving site(s) specific goals across Wayfair. They partner with others to ensure timely and cost efficient processing of the orders.
 
What You'll Do

You will create weekly and daily operating plans for site(s) and resolve variances between plan, actuals, and goals. Responsible for site plans at this cadence to align with Site leadership and network priorities.
You will monitor plans and work in process backlogs to consider impacts of future planning and staffing
You will provide input to strategic shift planning at the site to ensure the building is staffed according to short-mid-long term volume projections
Coordinate with local site operations and central planning teams to analyze historical data and forecast demand for that site
Manage and interpret the analyses of daily, weekly, and monthly reporting of site performance via Key Performance Indicators (Service Level Commitments)
You will be able to engage at shift level, in real time to make proactive changes to support execution of the daily operations plan
Youll be responsible for facilitating problem solving efforts when goals are not met based on current inputs to daily plan - i.e. Attrition, Absenteeism, Productivity
You will support site operations team by optimizing staffing requirements for the site specific daily plan
You will build a strong relationship with the site operations team to ensure proper execution of the daily level capacity / throughput plan through education in visibility to data and constant communication
Communicate with cross-functional leadership
Work in close collaboration with Network Planning, Field Industrial Engineering, Process Definition and Standards Excellence to enable performance management improvements
Beyond optimizing plans and backlogs, you will also directly empower and lead a small, dedicated team of warehouse associates, fostering a high-performance environment and ensuring seamless execution of daily operations.
Provide leadership coverage, confidently supporting other teams, ensuring continuous operational excellence across the floor.

 
What You'll Need

2+ years relevant experience in supply chain
Excellent communication skills - Able to guide and influence peers and leaders across levels and organization. Disseminate information effectively.
Technical aptitude in multiple systems; understanding of Google Suite, Data Visualization platforms, basic SQL/GBQ.
Preferred Bachelors Degree in a quantitative field (engineering, economics, math, and statistics), business or equivalent
Basic and working knowledge of Six Sigma tools and Lean techniques; process focused, organized and able to assess change management requirements
Strong understanding in the use of technical/statistical tools to drive process improvements

Title: Training Supervisor
RoleDescription:
The salary range for this position is $70,500 - $78,500 per year. The base salary offered may vary depending on location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. 
We are the front-line leaders in the new Wayfair Global Supply Chain Workforce Support Network. We are positioned forward at all the network locations providing direct training & development support to our Supply Chain teams. We bring network-wide resources along with realistic and challenging training initiatives to optimize performance, employee engagement, and professional development for associates and leaders. We are culture enthusiasts throughout our entire Supply Chain network.  
We are looking for a proven leader to influence cross-functional teams responsible for development, standard work, and championing the Wayfair culture in Cranbury, NJ. The candidate must be a collaborative problem solver, strategic planner, one who can build & manage high performing teams in a fast-paced, rapidly challenging, and fluid environment. 
What You'll Do

Coordinate, lead, and execute all training functions within the Cranbury, NJ fulfillment center including new hire orientation, job function training, and continuous development.
Organize, develop, and lead a team of exceptional and dedicated Training Ambassadors within the Warehouse Associate population; focus on improving safety, quality, and retention.
Lead various training sessions as needed, including but not limited to: New Hire Fundamentals, Powered Industrial Vehicle (PIV) training, Quality & Process (Current & New SOP) Training.
Provide professional development programming for warehouse associates and leaders. 
Record, track, and drive compliance on all training initiatives and report out on training metrics using Learning Management System.
Partner with Global Supply Chain Training & Engagement, Safety, and Operations teams to develop and improve training resources, strategies, and processes.
Support Global Supply Chain Training, Safety, and Operations by championing new training programs, processes, and initiatives; provide upward feedback and share observations with business owners to improve alignment, compliance, quality, and engagement.
Manage priorities, set goals, and partner strategically with stakeholders to align network training initiatives with the local sites operational and training needs.
Flex to perform work and lead by example on the warehouse floor alongside department leaders and associates during high volume seasons or as needed

What Youll Need

3+ years of experience in Training, Learning & Development and/or Organizational Leadership OR 4 year degree in relevant field, required
Experience in Operations or Supply Chain preferred
Raymond and/or Crown forklift/powered industrial vehicle certifications preferred.  Willingness to be trained on multiple vehicle types required.
Leadership skills and the ability to make decisions with little or no guidance based on policies or best practices.
Exceptional written and verbal communication to effectively communicate with all stakeholder levels.
Strong organizational skills and attention to detail.
A seek-to-understand mindset and teamwork strategies that will allow you to connect with and influence diverse groups of people, including your training audience and stakeholder network.

Title: Senior Business Analyst, Transportation & Delivery Enablement
RoleDescription:
At this time, Wayfair does not provide visa sponsorship for employment authorization for this position.
 
Must be on-site in Boston, MA (Monday-Thursday)
The salary range for this position is $104,500 - 118,250. The base pay offered may vary depending on location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience.
 
Senior Business Analyst, Transportation & Delivery Process
We're looking for a Senior Business Analyst to join our Transportation & Delivery Process and Technology Enablement team. In this role, you'll be a key player in implementing new technology and processes for our last-mile delivery network. Your responsibilities will include gathering requirements from business stakeholders, validating them with our engineering team, and supporting the successful rollout of new solutions. You'll also be responsible for providing valuable insights into project performance.
Who We Are
The Global T&D Process & Technology Enablement team is the driving force behind significant change at Wayfair. We are the "go-to" team for any disruptive technology or process in the first, middle, or last mile of our supply chain. We ensure successful implementations by bringing the right people together, considering all implications during the design and build phases, and tracking the success of our rollouts. Our team is based in Boston but travels frequently to our Home Delivery Operations facilities to oversee new launches.
What You'll Do 
We are looking for an analytical, action-oriented, and collaborative individual who can translate business problems to tech improvements, actionable insights and data driven solutions  within the last mile delivery space, to influence operational results and tech systems. Successful individuals in this role excel at both qualitative and quantitative analysis while also being eager to communicate upward and outward to tell a concise story through data.

Become a SME in Wayfairs last mile tech and processes in order to answer questions from business stakeholders & execution and attend process and tech escalations
Become a liaison between engineering and business stakeholders to funnel the right requirements and convert them into product or process enhancements
Communicate regularly with cross functional partners to understand process gaps, business trends and new ways to break down problems into solutions
Engage in roadmapping and prioritization through diligent opportunity sizing and scoping efforts
Build dashboards, visualizations and prototypes to translate data sets into insights and actions
Conduct ad hoc analyses and build advanced reports 
Support tech and process rollout from requirements gathering to launch
Manage processes and multiple engagements with key cross-functional partners

What You'll Need 

Bachelors degree in a quantitative field
2+ years of professional experience
Team-first attitude with enthusiasm for cross-functional collaboration
High attention to detail and proven ability to manage multiple, competing priorities simultaneously
An entrepreneurial spirit and mindset; you must be adaptable and comfortable with change. 
Potential travel to Wayfair sites up to once/month
Advanced experience with Microsoft Excel or Google Sheets, SQL or GBQ, and data visualization tools such as Google Data Studio (Looker, Tableau, or PowerBI)

An Important Note about Wayfair's In-Office Policy:
All Boston-based interns, Co-ops, and corporate employees will be in office in a hybrid capacity. Employees will work in the office on designated days, Monday - Thursday, and work remotely Friday.

Title: Senior Assistant Store Manager, Sales & Retail Engagement
RoleDescription:
Senior Assistant Store Manager, Sales & Retail Engagement
Location: 3232 Lake Ave. Wilmette, IL
The salary range (or base pay) for this position is $117,000 - $130,000, however, base pay offered may vary depending on location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. A performance bonus may be a part of the compensation package, in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits, dependent on the position offered.
Overview: 
At Wayfair, we deliver a best-in-class customer experience in furniture and home by empowering talented, driven individuals like you. As a Senior Assistant Store Manager of Sales, youll lead the sales floor team/ This includes sales, design, and customer experience to create seamless, welcoming shopping journeys. Youll be a key partner to the General Manager, driving sales, optimizing operations, and fostering collaboration across specialty categories like appliances, home improvement, and mattresses. If youre passionate about coaching teams, solving challenges in a fast-paced environment, and delivering authentic, customer-focused service, your professional home awaits you here at Wayfair.
What Does a Sr. Assistant Store Manager Do?

 Lead Sales & Design Teams: Directly manage and develop the sales floor team, including managers, sales associates, designers, and customer experience specialists, ensuring customers receive top-notch support and service.
 Be a Senior Operational Partner: Serve as a key-holder and senior support across Assistant Store Manager duties, especially in specialty areas like appliances, home improvement, and mattresses, to keep store operations running smoothly.
 Unite Store Teams: Collaborate across Salesfloor, Logistics, Visual, Asset Protection, Talent, and more to align goals and execute store-wide initiatives that elevate customer experience and business success.
 Champion Customer Experience: Deliver authentic, friendly service while coaching your team to build complex, connected solutions that balance speed with personalized attention.
 Drive Sales & Results: Partner with the General Manager to optimize our store processes, manage profitability, control labor expenses, and translate data into actionable coaching and team improvements.
 Foster Collaboration & Culture: Create a positive, team-first environment by encouraging cross-functional collaboration and continuous growth among Associates, Specialists, and Designers.
 Own Floor Operations: Maintain strong leadership presence as Manager on Duty handling scheduling, opening and closing procedures, and ensuring the right team is in the right place at the right time.
 Innovate & Improve: Contribute ideas for new tools, processes, and technologies that help your teams work smarter and more efficiently.
 Manage Multiple Priorities: Stay organized and communicate clearly while juggling fast-paced demands and following through on action plans.
 Partner with Home Office: Work closely with corporate teams to share insights and support store performance enhancements.

Youll Thrive in this Role if You Have:

 Proven Leadership: 5+ years managing large teams in fast-paced, high-volume retail or specialty selling environments, where you led with confidence and clear direction.
 Customer-Obsessed: Strong background in selling and delivering exceptional, authentic customer servicealways focused on creating memorable experiences.
 Operational Excellence: Experience driving processes and operations as designed, with a knack for optimizing workflows and boosting team performance.
 Analytical Mindset: Comfortable diving into data, interpreting KPIs, and making smart, data-driven decisions to continuously improve results.
 People Developer: Skilled at coaching, mentoring, and motivating others, fostering growth and accountability with empathy and professionalism.
 Cross-Team Collaborator: Able to bring together multiple teams and functions, aligning diverse stakeholders behind a common goal.
 Tech Confident: Comfortable using Google Suite, inventory management systems, and ready to quickly learn new tools that empower your team.
 Flexible & Dependable: Willing to work varied retail hours including early mornings, evenings, weekends, and holidays to meet business and customer needs.
 Hands-On Attitude: Ready to jump in on the floor or in the warehousewhether its stocking shelves, managing inventory, or helping with physical tasks.

Additional Physical and Environmental Requirements:

 Physical Activity: Frequent standing, walking, and reaching with hands and arms; occasional sitting, climbing, balancing, and crawling.
 Mobility & Movement: Frequent stooping, kneeling, and crouching throughout the day.
 Lifting Ability: Must be able to lift and/or move up to 50 lbs regularly.
 Vision Requirements: Includes close, distance, color, and peripheral vision; depth perception and the ability to adjust focus.
 Temperature Flexibility: Comfortable in environments with varying temperature conditions.
 Noise Tolerance: Occasional exposure to moderate noise levels and physical activity.
 Safety Awareness: Minimal exposure to workplace or environmental hazardsmust adhere to all safety protocols.

What are the Benefits*?

 Competitive Pay: Earn competitive compensation, with regular opportunities for performance-based increases and performance based bonuses.
 Career Growth: Access professional development and advancement opportunities to help you grow with us.
 Health Benefits from Day One: Medical, dental, and vision insurance coverage starts on your first day.
 Time to Recharge: Take the time you need with our generous PTO policy for L4+ leaders which is designed to support work-life balance while aligning with our business needs and team priorities.
 401(k) with Company Match: Well match up to 4% to help you plan for your future.
 Tuition Reimbursement: Eligible after 6 months of employmentlearn, grow, and get support along the way.
 Wayfair Employee Discount: Save big on the pieces you loveplus get 10% off at our in-store restaurant .
 Parental Leave Options: Choose from paid and unpaid leave plans to support your growing family.
 And So Much More: Weve got more good stuff where that came from! Our full-time roles receive the full benefits package, while part-time or seasonal team members may have modified offerings. Your recruiter or in-store team can help with any questions!
